stimulusHtml: ​The function f{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is defined by fx=3secx{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}. The function g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is defined by gx=1fx{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}. Which of the following is the graph of g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} in the xy{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-plane?
choicesHtml:
• All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • Four open points are marked on the x y coordinate plane.
    • The open points are marked on the following coordinates:
      • (negative 3 pi over 2 comma 0)
      • (negative pi over 2 comma 0)
      • (pi over 2 comma 0)
      • (3 pi over 2 comma 0)
    • The curve begins at a point (negative 2 pi comma 0.3).
    • The curve trends down gradually to the right to first open point (negative 3 pi over 2 comma 0).
    • The curve continues down and right, leveling off at a minimum point at (negative pi comma negative 0.3).
    • At point (negative pi comma negative 0.3), the curve trends up gradually to the right to the second open point (negative pi over 2 comma 0).
    • The curve continues up and right, leveling off at a maximum point at (0 comma 0.3).
    • At point (0 comma 0.3), the curve trends down gradually to the right to the third open point (pi over 2 comma 0).
    • The curve continues down and right, leveling off at a minimum point at (pi comma negative 0.3).
    • At point (pi comma negative 0.3), the curve trends up gradually to the right to the fourth open point (3 pi over 2 comma 0).
    • At point (3 pi over 2 comma 0), the curve continues to trend up gradually to the right and ends at the point (2 pi comma 0.3).

• All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • Five open points are marked on the x y coordinate plane.
    • The open points are marked on the following coordinates:
      • (negative 2 pi comma 0)
      • (negative pi comma 0)
      • (0 comma 0)
      • (pi comma 0)
      • (2 pi comma 0)
    • The curve begins at the first open point (negative 2 pi comma 0).
    • The curve trends up and right, leveling off at a maximum point at (negative 3 pi over 2 comma 0.3).
    • At point (negative 3 pi over 2 comma 0.3), the curve trends down gradually to the right to the second open point (negative pi comma 0).
    • The curve continues down and right, leveling off at a minimum point at (pi over 2 comma negative 0.3).
    • At point (pi over 2 comma negative 0.3), the curve trends up gradually to the right to the third open point (0 comma 0).
    • The curve continues up and right, leveling off at a maximum point at (pi over 2 comma 0.3).
    • At point (pi over 2 comma 0.3), the curve trends down gradually to the right to the fourth open point (pi comma 0).
    • The curve continues down and right, leveling off at a minimum point at (3 pi over 2 comma negative 0.3).
    • At point (3 pi over 2 comma negative 0.3), the curve trends up gradually to the right ending at the fifth open point (2 pi comma 0).

​​

• All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right: 
    • The curve begins at a point (negative 2 pi comma 3).
    • The curve trends down to the right gradually then more steeply, through the point (negative 3 pi over 2 comma 0), and levels to reach a minimum point at (negative pi comma negative 3).
    • The curve trends up to the right gradually then more steeply, through the point (negative pi over 2 comma 0), and levels to reach a maximum point at (0 comma 3).
    • The curve trends down to the right gradually then more steeply, through the point (pi over 2 comma 0), and levels to reach a minimum point at (pi comma negative 3).
    • The curve trends up to the right gradually then more steeply, through the point (3 pi over 2 comma 0), and levels to end at (2 pi comma 3).

• All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at a point (negative 2 pi comma 0).
    • The curve trends up to the right and levels at (negative 3 pi over 2 comma 3).
    • The curve trends down to the right gradually then more steeply, through the point (negative pi comma 0), and levels to reach a minimum point at (negative pi over 2 comma negative 3).
    • The curve trends up to the right gradually then more steeply, through the point (0 comma 0), and levels to reach a maximum point at (pi over 2 comma 3).
    • The curve trends down to the right gradually then more steeply, through the point (pi comma 0), and levels to reach a minimum point at (3 pi over 2 comma negative 3).
    • The curve trends up to the right and levels to end at (2 pi comma 0).
